title: Michael Carrick hails Sean Longstaff after Man Utd defeat to Newcastle
text:

Michael Carrick has hailed Geordie midfielder Sean Longstaff as a ­“fantastic talent”.

Newcastle yesterday stepped up their efforts to tie Sean and his brother Matty, who scored the winner against Manchester United on Sunday, to new deals.

Matty, 19, is an urgent case with his £1,000-a-week contract ­expiring at the end of the ­season.

Sean, 21, signed a new deal worth £8,000 a week 10 months ago before his first-team ­breakthrough. But he is in for a pay rise, especially with United eyeing a £30million swoop.

Reds first-team coach Carrick was back on Tyneside yesterday opening a new pitch at his ­boyhood side Wallsend Boys Club, alongside Alan Shearer.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Both legends hailed the ­impact of the Longstaff brothers and spoke of the importance of giving young English kids a chance in the first team.

Carrick said: “Sean is a fantastic ­talent and doing well at the ­moment. He hasn’t played a awful lot of games yet, but the ­future is bright for him.

(Image: Newcastle Chronicle)

“I don’t like ­comparing his playing style to mine. It is not fair on Sean. He is ­carving his own career out. He has his own traits and strengths. I ­always enjoy seeing young ­players getting a chance.

“Shearer and me needed a chance. Every player does, and it is up to you to take it.”

Shearer said of Sean Longstaff: ­“Definitely he has traits (of Carrick). He has had a good start. Newcastle are a better team with him in it, because of his energy and legs he gives the team, and his ability to receive the ball.

“His passing ability is fantastic. A proud ­moment for the boys and the family. Maybe Newcastle have been missing that energy and vibrancy.”
description: Sean Longstaff has been a transfer target for Man Utd for around a year and impressed in front of coach Michael Carrick on Sunday
